Name: Tim Southee
Teams: New Zealand, New Zealand U19, Chennai Super Kings, Essex, Basnahira Cricket Dundee, Rajasthan Royals, Northern Knights, Mumbai Indians, New Zealand A, Middlesex, Royal Challengers Bangalore, Vancouver Knights, Team Williamson, Kolkata Knight Riders
Bio: a right-arm swing bowler,burst upon the international scene in great style,with only one T20I cap behind him,fresh from a Player-of-the-Tournament performance at the 2008 Under-19 World Cup when he was hed a Test debut against Engl in Napier,Southee responded with 5 for 55 before smashing 77 off 40 balls in the second innings with nine sixes,It was a debut that gave a clear indication of the career to come,Over the next decade or so,Southee would go on to form one of the world's best new-ball partnerships with Trent Boult,would also come to be known for his ability to clear the fence,He hit his 50th six in only his 36th Test,could one day take the Test record for most sixes from his long-time captain Brendon McCullum
